1.title: Launch Night
1.plot: 14 Former Big Brother contestants share a House sealed from the outside world for up to 3 months. Watching over these Housemates is Big Brother - heard only via a voice. He is the all-seeing all-knowing authoritarian figure who monitors the Housemates' every move. Every week Housemates nominate each other for Eviction in a secret ballot. The viewers then vote to decide who will be Evicted. The last person left wins the major cash prize.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Big Brother is a television show made in the UK, where contestants take part in a challenge to see who will last the longest in the Big brother house, The winner will take home a large cash prize while the losers take home nothing.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: 14 former Housemates return and are seen living together, while being filmed 24 hours per day. Housemates must remain in the house at all times, and avoid being evicted by viewers of the show with the aim of winning a substantial cash prize at the end of the series.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Big Brother is the original and unparalleled social experiment. For the most part, the 14 Housemates are left to do as they please in a hyper-real environment largely unpenetrated by the outside world while everything they do is watched by cameras - and ultimately the public.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Big Brother is a British reality game show in which fourteen contestants, referred to as housemates, live in isolation from the outside world in a custom built "house" for 18 days, constantly under video surveillance from Big Brother.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Big Brother is a game show in which a group of contestants, referred to as housemates, live in isolation from the outside world in a custom built "house", constantly under video surveillance. During their time in the house, the housemates are required to nominate two of their fellow contestants for potential eviction, and the two or more with the most votes would be nominated. This process is mandatory for all housemates, and failure to comply could result in expulsion from the house. During the show's broadcast, the viewers would vote to evict one of the nominated ...

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: 14 previous Big Brother contestants return to the house and must compete against each other for a chance to win a cash prize in a house wired with cameras and microphones, capturing their every move for a TV and Internet audience.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: A group of 14 people selected from a national search share a House sealed from the outside world for up to 100 days. Watching over these Housemates is Big Brother - heard only via a voice. He is the all-seeing all-knowing authoritarian figure who monitors the Housemates' every move. Every week Housemates nominate each other for Eviction in a secret ballot. The viewers then vote to decide who will be Evicted. The last person left wins the major cash prize.
